notification.message:
Welcome to the Alpha Release of ResMe!! We're glad you could join us. Before you go off and start clicking buttons
and messing with features, you should check out these pages first:

The first, and most important, page you should check out is your Privacy Settings page. With this, you can decide how
people interact with your profile.

The second thing you should check out is our About page, where you can learn about what ResMe is and what we can do
for you.

Some other pages you'll find useful:
  • Profile Settings
  • Resume Management

Wow, It's been a long time since the last update. A lot of things have been changed as well as new features being added! Hopefully I can list all the important ones here:

The homepage has been redesigned to make it easier for you to access specific things that might interest you. Moving your mouse over the tabs on the left side and clicking them will let you change what is being displayed here. A brief explanation for each tab is provided below:
  • ResMe News -- Any ResMe updates or deicsions that effect you will show up here. Be sure to check this often to stay on top of changes to ResMe!
  • Notifications -- Interactions between other ResMe users and you will be posted here.
  • User Articles -- This section is designed specifically for ResMe users to share articles they find about the Economy, or the Job Market. You can also use this to share any advice you have.
  • Explore Resumes -- Resumes which we think might interest you are listed here. Maybe they're popular resumes, or resumes in the same professoin as you either way, there might be something to learn.
  • Your Stack -- These are the resumes that you've chose to save.

Another new feature that's been added is saving other people's resumes to your "stack". At the top of each profile is a button that will let you add or remove resumes from your stack. This is a convenient way to save resumes that you think are useful so you can easily look them up at a later time. You'll be notified of any changes to resumes in your stack.

The Privacy Settings page has also been improved to be clearer and give you more control over how your resume is accessed. Be sure to check it out!
